地平線の向こう側で戦争が起こり、不要な活動はせずに戦闘の準備を行わなければならない。この知らせを考慮して、[From.GetTitledFirstName]は[From.Capital.GetName]の祭りを中止せざるを得なかった。
壮大な祭りはまさに[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]の人々が部族の仲間との絆を強化するために必要なものだ。 また、首長が先祖に供物を捧げることで、私たちの土地に繁栄をもたらす良い機会となるだろう。
§Y宮廷§!と§Y封臣§!に招待状を送る。

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]にご挨拶申し上げる。
[From.Capital.GetName]で素晴らしい祭りが開催されている。 あなたの家族と共に我々の幸運を祝い、供物を祖先にさ捧げようではないか。

署名
[From.GetFullName]
それは、素晴らしい考えだ!
§Y大部族祭§!に参加させていただきとても嬉しいです、我が君。

[Root.GetSocietyRank]万歳!

部族民の仲間のために偉大な祭りの準備をされているとの噂を聞きました。あなたは仲間の戦士と話をして楽しんでいることでしょう。

(署名) [From.GetFullName]
今回は参加されなくて結構
祭りが始まろうとしている。 あらゆる種類の商人、吟遊詩人、占い師が[great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]に集まり、物語を披露し、供物を捧げようとしている。部族の皆に会う旅行へ出る前に、祭りのために準備をしなければならない。
祭りが始まろうとしている。 国中の行商人、吟遊詩人、占い師が[great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]に集まり、物語を披露し、供物を捧げようとしている。 これはきっと新しい人と出会い、新しい遊びを覚える素晴らしい機会になるだろう。
狩猟技能を磨きながら、外で過ごそう。
I will take time to groom myself.
Make sure to look at your best before meeting the other tribesmen.
我々の古い伝説を勉強しよう。
祖先の伝承や物語について調べながら過ごそう。
先祖への供物を用意するために部族内で最も熟練の職人に探しながら過ごそう。
私は、何も心配しなくていい。
素晴らしい祭りとなるだろう!
お祝いがようやく始まった。 [Root.Capital.GetName]は活気にあふれている。[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]の隅々から来た人々は私や私の先祖に敬意を払い、物語や物を交換し、楽しい時間を過ごすためにここを訪れた。
お祝いがようやく始まった。 [From.Capital.GetName]は活気にあふれている。[From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]の隅々から来た人たちは、[From.GetTitledFirstName]と[From.GetHerHis]の先祖に敬意を払い、物語や物を交換し、楽しい時間を過ごすためにここを訪れた。
人ごみの中から枯れた声が私の名前を呼んでいることに気が付いた。一人の老いた占い師が、古い石のそばに座って私を待っている。彼は私の将来を僅かな代金で占うと言った。
老婦人が突然私の視界に飛び込んできて、歯のない顔に微笑を浮かべ、サイコロの入ったコップを振っている。彼女は、正当な見返りをくれれば星のお告げを教えてやろうといっている。
大祭に引き寄せられた行商人たちの商品を見定めていると、ぼろきれに身を包んだ奇妙な少年の不気味な視線と合わさった。その子は、周りの群衆の動きを無視して私にゆっくりと近づいてきて、私の未来をほんの僅かな値段で読めるとささやいた。
そのようなことに費やしている時間は無い!
The fortuneteller surprises me by predicting that extraordinary opportunities are about to present themselves to me in my near future, and I need only to pay close attention to find my good fortune.
I always knew I was born lucky!
The fortuneteller assures me that a period of good luck is just around the corner, and that I need only look for the right opportunities in order to change my life for the better.
兆候を徹底的に調べた後、占い師は私の将来が暗いように見えるので、私と家族に災難が降りないように次の選択には十分気をつけなければならないと警告した。
[great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]の賑やかな通りを歩いていると、強烈な香りに気を取られ、道の片隅に立つ老錬金術師の元に導かれた。私の関心を見抜いた男は、幾つかの品物やその驚異的な効果を見せて来た。
惚れ薬なんかはどうだ？
この飲み物で魅力が増すのか？
この香水と引き換えに供物を焼いてやろう。
気にするな、あなたが売っているものに興味はない。
[great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]の賑やかな通りを歩いていると、強烈な香りに気を取られ、道の片隅に立つ老錬金術師の元に導かれた。私の関心を見抜いた男は、幾つかの品物やその驚異的な効果を見せて来た。
この飲み物で魅力が増すのか？
I will burn an offering for you, in exchange for this amulet.
私はこの魔術を必要としない。
年老いた商人が[great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]の中心に巨大な出店を設営し、祭りの最後に使うための様々な御守りや装身具を神々や先祖への供物として販売している。なにか心惹かれるものを買うべきだろうか……
最も高価な宝石以外に私に相応しいものはない。
この御守りは十分に価値あるものだろう……
本当に買わ必要はあるだろうか……
無駄遣いするお金はない。

I stumbled on [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetTitledFirstName] in the main hall with a group of other distinguished guests. I have heard quite a few good things about [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHim] in the past, and I wonder if this festival is the right occasion to earn [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHis] friendship.
Let me offer you a drink, [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName]!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] and I spent the evening telling old tales of our clans to each other, having a very good time alongside the other guests of [great_tribal_festival_host.GetTitledFirstName]'s feast. I never noticed how likable [From.GetFirstName] was before...
But what does [From.GetSheHe] *really* wants from me?
We should do this again, sometimes.

For some reason, [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName] has entirely rejected my offer of friendship. I think [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHis] paranoid nature might have gotten the best of [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHim]...

[tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName] spent a great evening in the long-house, telling old legends and drinking with the other tribesmen. When finally leaving, right before dawn, we swore an oath of friendship.
We should do this more often!

[tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName] and I spent a very pleasant evening in the long-house, telling old legends and drinking with the other tribesmen. We left the hall at dawn, both glad to have had this opportunity to strengthen our relation.
We should do this more often!

I was busy exchanging tales with some of the other tribesmen, when [From.GetTitledFirstName] approaches me with a smile, offering me a drink, claiming that [From.GetSheHe] wishes to make a toast to new friendships.
What?! What's your angle? Is it poisoned?!
[tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetTitledFirstName]がロングハウスに来て、部族の者たちと笑いあい飲み交わしながら楽しい時間を過ごしている。耐えがたい光景だ。なんとかしてこの不快な馬鹿騒ぎを止めさせられないだろうか。
策を練る必要があるな……
Try to get §Y[tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! drunk to humiliate [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHim].
Openly insult §Y[tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! in front of all the guests.

It looks like [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetFirstName] is smarter than [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetSheHe] looks. [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetSheHeCap] was able to see through my deception and reject my false offer of friendship.
Oh well... I guess that's it for tonight then.

Just as I hoped, I was able to get [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetTitledFirstName] completely drunk and isolate [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHim] from [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHis] friends. Now is the time to reveal my true intentions...
Lead §Y[tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! into the wilderness and abandon [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHim] there.
Shame on you! What sort of [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetManWoman] are you?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] fooled me! After getting me drunk, [From.GetSheHe] abandoned me in the wilderness, in the dead of night. I am too tired and confused to find my way back to the tribe, and I think I hear something growling nearby...

I do not understand. One moment [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I are having fun, drinking and exchanging tales, and the moment after [From.GetSheHe] is insulting me, shaming me for being nothing but a drunken fool in front of everybody.
Whu-? I thought we were friends...

We were all happily celebrating our good fortune in [great_tribal_festival_host.GetTitledFirstName]'s long-house, when [From.GetTitledFirstName] decided to ruin the mood of the feast by yelling my name and showering me with insults, clearly trying to upset me.

I have received several complaints from my guests in the last days regarding [warrior_lodge_guest.GetTitledFirstName]. Apparently, [warrior_lodge_guest.GetSheHe] has been going around town, picking fights, bragging about [warrior_lodge_guest.GetHerHis] great feats and shaming my own tribesmen for lacking in strength and courage.
I am sure we can solve this series of misunderstandings...

The priests are preparing a large feast to offer to our ancestors tonight. I have been spying at the servants bringing in the offerings in the great hall for some time. Some of my friends have dared me to see if I can sneak in and out under the priests' noses without being spotted.

I am only a few step into the main hall when I hear somebody call for me. One of the priests has spotted me! With my face growing red, I manage to run away just in time to avoid being caught. My playmates welcome me with a shower of chuckles.

With just a bit of care, I manage to sneak past the servants and get into the main hall. The weird statues of the ancestors are all assembled near the long table, decorated with trinkets and surrounded by food.

I was surprised to hear that the statues in the temple of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName] have moved to a nefarious position. The priests wander around town informing everyone of the prodigious event for several hour before news comes out that the misplacement was just the result of [From.GetFirstName] sneaking into the temple and rearranging them.

[From.GetFirstName] managed to sneak into the temple and rearrange the positions of the ancestors' statues! Even better, the old priests thought that the statues had moved by themselves and went screaming around town that a terrible calamity was about to strike all of us before they learned the truth and became the laughing stock of town.

[From.GetFirstName] and some of [From.GetHerHis] playmates have stolen the offerings for tonight's feast of the ancestors. The priests were furious to find the little piglets sleeping in the woods near [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName], surrounded by the remains of their loot.

[From.GetFirstName] managed to sneak inside the temple and steal some of the offerings for the ancestors. [From.GetSheHeCap] them brought them outside of town and shared them with the rest of us. We spent the rest of the evening laughing at the grown-ups wandering around the tribe, trying to understand what happened to the missing food.
And now we have to pay for more offerings...
特に裕福で不愉快な商人がこの大祭のために町に呼ばれている。私の遊び友達の一人が私に、彼が必死に値切りをしている間に彼の小道具の一つを盗んで、彼が過去に私たち子供から搾取した時間を償わせようと言ってきた。
彼のスタンドから、最も大きい宝石を取ってこよう!
Try to steal a trinket from the merchant's stand.

Just as I stretch my arm to pick the item from the stand, the merchant grabs me by the wrist and pushes me aside, warning me to keep away from his wares. Trying again now that he has been put on alert would just be a waste of time, so I am forced to return to my playmates empty-handed.

It takes just a few moments of distraction for me to snatch one of the merchant's amulets and run away in the crowd before he can even realize that he has been robbed. I return triumphant to my playmates, and we spend the rest of the afternoon looking from a safe distance the old merchant scrambling through his wares, trying to find the missing trinket.

Today's festivities were disrupted by the complaints of a foreign merchant. The old man spent most of the afternoon claiming that one of the town's kids had stolen a precious amulet from his stand and would not leave until he received compensation for his losses.
大祭のために、特に裕福で不快な商人が町に引き寄せられてきている。彼は町に来るといつも私や遊び仲間に意地悪なので、今年は仕返しすることにした。[From.GetFirstName]は、彼が他のことに気を取られている間に、彼のスタンドの後ろに忍び寄り、彼の最も貴重な小道具の一つを盗み、その日の残りの時間を商人がそれを探すのに費やさざるを得ないようにすることにした。
Fine. Take this money and leave.

The festival has attracted many people from all over the realm to [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]. Unfortunately, many of the new grownups are stuck-up bores with no good manners. I have half a mind to gather a few of my playmates and teach them a lesson...
来客たちに泥を投げつけて祭りを台無しにする。
Eh, that is just how grownups are...

We have barely started having fun when a some of the tribes' warriors decide to take matters in their own hands and take on us. All my friends immediately desert me, leaving me alone to face the angry tribesmen.

With just the help of a few other kids and a well-placed tree, we are able to successfully throw the entire party into disarray. People scream and run for cover, yelling our names and throwing back swears at us. When the adults finally organize to get us, we have already dispersed to laugh off the successful mission.
We should do this again next year!

I was just chatting with some of the other tribesmen in the main square of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName], when something hit me on the back! Shouts and complaints swiftly follow, turning the entire square into a complete chaos. A few of the kids have climbed on a nearby tree and they have started throwing mud at the rest of us!
Some of the town's kids, led by [From.GetTitledFirstName], have decided to pester their parents and neighbors by throwing mud at them in the middle of the morning fair.

[From.GetFirstName] decided to take me and some of the other kids and get back at some of the stuck-up adults in our town by laying a trap on them during the morning fair, to cover them in mud and slush. And it was an absolute triumph.

All the grownups are busy, and I am bored. As I try to think of something to do, I spot [scoped_running_child_1.GetFirstName] and suddenly remember about that time [scoped_running_child_1.GetSheHe] bragged about being the fastest kid of the whole tribe.
Challenge §Y[scoped_running_child_1.GetFirstName]§! to a race around town.
実際には、昼寝をするだけかもしれない。

[From.GetFirstName] challenged me to a race around town to determine who is the fastest kid of the tribe. [From.GetSheHeCap] seems very confident that [From.GetSheHe] will win and has already started to tease me that I am too much of a coward to even accept [From.GetHerHis] challenge.

Turns out that [From.GetFirstName] was too much of a coward to pick up my challenge. [From.GetSheHeCap] has run away with [From.GetHerHis] tail between [From.GetHerHis] legs, throwing some poor excuse to avoid the race.

After we gather a few playmates to act as witnesses, [From.GetFirstName] and I are off running around town, dodging servants, scaring off farm animals, zigzagging through the fields for the quickest path. Several minutes later, I jump head-first over the final line, surrounded by the cheers of the other kids.

After we gather a few playmates to act as witnesses, [From.GetFirstName] and I are off running around town, dodging servants, scaring off farm animals, zigzagging through the fields for the quickest path. Unfortunately, just a few steps before the finishing line, I trip over a rock and fall to the ground, allowing [From.GetFirstName] to surpass me.

There is an old tree at the edge of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]. Kids say it is more than one hundred years old, and that sometimes the ancestors use it as a ladder to get into our world, and nobody aside from the shamans ever gets close to it.
And I am going to climb it!

It was not easy. Every few steps I had to stop and hold my breath, listening to the ominous creaking coming from the gray branches of the old tree. And yet, with just a bit of patience and stubbornness, I was able to get all the way to the top. There are no gods around as far as I can see, but I have a full view of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName].

I was almost halfway through the climbing, when an ominous creaking announced the breaking of one of the branches I was balancing a foot on. Grabbing at the air and letting out a choked squeal, I fall from the old tree.
客人同士の乱闘や果たし合いが何度かあったのをうけて、群衆を静めるには最高の戦士達による闘技会を催すのが一番だと決まった。部族の多くの者が自分の勇猛さを友好的な試合で示せる機会に沸き立っただけでなく、呪術師もこれが[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]の恩寵を得るよい方法だと請け合った。
いい考えだ。私も参加するぞ。
勇気あるものは前に出よ！
客人同士の乱闘や果たし合いが何度かあったのをうけて、群衆を静めるには最高の戦士達による闘技会を催すのが一番だと決まった。部族の多くの者が自分の勇猛さを友好的な試合で示せる機会に沸き立っただけでなく、呪術師もこれが[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]の恩寵を得るよい方法だと請け合った。
私は他の戦士達を応援するだけにしよう。
最近、祝宴の最中に数人の戦士の間で乱闘騒ぎとなり、招待客の多くは誰が最も酒豪であるかを決めるため、壮大な酒合戦を始めた。
いい考えだ。私も参加するぞ。
屈強な戦士たちを前進させろ！

Many of the guests in [great_tribal_festival_host.GetTitledFirstName]'s long-house have taken the habits of organizing drinking games during the great feasts we are holding almost every night to celebrate the old gods.
Eh, I will just cheer on the others.

With so many lavish feasts being prepared for the festival, many of my guests have started to talk about out-competing each other to see who amongst them can eat fastest and the most, to the point that every other night we have an eating contest or two.
面白そうだ、私もやってみよう！
I will just cheer on the others.

With so many lavish feasts being prepared for the festival, many of [great_tribal_festival_host.GetTitledFirstName]'s guests have started to talk about out-competing each other to see who amongst them can eat fastest and the most, to the point that every other night we have an eating contest or two.
面白そうだ、私もやってみよう！
I will just cheer on the others.
この大部族祭のおかげで、馬小屋はたくさんの立派な馬でいっぱいになった。中にはあまり調教されていない馬もいる。一部の戦士たちは、我々の家畜の中で最も野生的な馬を調教する競争しようと考えており、それは私のゲストを楽しませつつ、最も荒い馬を調教するための完璧な方法だと思われる。
優勝者には馬を与えよう!

この大部族祭のおかげで、[great_tribal_festival_host.GetTitledFirstName]の馬小屋はたくさんの立派な馬でいっぱいになった。中にはあまり調教されていない馬もいる。一部の戦士たちは、[great_tribal_festival_host.GetHerHis]の家畜の中で最も野生的な馬を調教する競争しようと考えており、それは[great_tribal_festival_host.GetHerHis]のゲストを楽しませつつ、最も荒い馬を調教するための完璧な方法だと思われる。
I will cheer on the tamers.
一部の顧問や呪術師達が客人達を楽しませる名案があると言ってきた。この祝祭の期間中に、[Root.Capital.GetName]で最も見目麗しい者を探す平和的なコンテストを開催するというものだ。
いいだろう。勝つのは私だ。
全ての候補者に会ってみようじゃないか...
[From.GetTitledFirstName]と顧問団は今年の祝祭で美男美女コンテストを開催することを思いついた。客人達も参加できるということだ。
完璧だ！もう待ちきれないよ！
品定めされるより、する方が得意だ。
多くの旅行者や詩人が[Root.Capital.GetName]に来て、物語を交換したり、お祭りの期間を楽しんだりしているので、我々は詩のコンテストを開催して、どの客が最も鋭い舌を持っているかを見るべきだという結論に達した。
鑑賞する方が楽しいだろう。
多くの旅行者や詩人が[From.Capital.GetName]に来て、物語を交換したり、お祭りの期間を楽しんだりしているので、[From.GetTitledFirstName]は詩のコンテストを開催して、[From.GetHerHis]のどの客が最も鋭い舌を持っているかを見るべきだという結論に達した。
I am a [Root.GetTitle], not an entertainer.

With so many travelers and bards coming to [Root.Capital.GetName] to exchange stories and enjoy the period of festivities, I have come to the conclusion that we should simply organize a singing contest, to see which of our guests has the sweetest voice.
鑑賞する方が楽しいだろう。

With so many travelers and bards coming to [From.Capital.GetName] to exchange stories and enjoy the period of festivities, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to organize a great singing contest, to see which of [From.GetHerHis] guests has the sweetest voice.
I am a [Root.GetTitle], not an entertainer.
多くの才能のある職人が[Root.Capital.GetName]に惹かれて集まっており、先祖のためにいくつかの供物を作成するための技能を発揮している。 彼らの能力を最大限に活用するために、私は、最高の職人を互いに競わせる機織りコンテストを開催することにした。
And I will take part in it too.
これは、我々にさらにおおくの供物をもたらすだろう。
多くの才能のある職人が[Root.Capital.GetName]に惹かれて集まっており、先祖のためにいくつかの供物を作成するための技能を発揮している。 彼らの能力を最大限に活用するために、[From.GetTitledFirstName]は、最高の職人を互いに競わせる機織りコンテストを開催することにした。
I will create the best tapestry of all!
最初の選手たちが競技場で自分の場所を見つけると、観衆はすぐに町の広場に集まった。私は最初に選出された選手の一人であり、周りで歓声を上げる部族の臣下の中を避けながら進む変わった風貌の対戦相手をすぐに見つけた。

The crowd quickly assembles in the town square as the first contenders find their place in the fighting ring. The first brawl starts with encouraging cheers from everyone. Soon, a series of bruised warriors finds its place in the losers' corner.
長い列を作って部族民が隣り合って座り、大型のジョッキをテーブルにたたきつけながら、選りすぐりの競争者達を、もう一杯もう一杯、と大声ではやし立てた。私は咳払いをして数度瞬きをして角の杯が満たされ直すのを待ち、近くの対戦相手をちらりと見て意気込みを強くした。
長い列を作って部族民が隣り合って座り、大型のジョッキをテーブルにたたきつけ、選りすぐりの競争者達へ、もう一杯もう一杯、と大声ではやし立てる。段々と幾人かの競争者の飲む勢いは落ち、最後には自らの頭をテーブルに打ち付けることになった。

A long line of tribesmen sit one next to each other, slamming their fists on the table and loudly inciting the few contenders to eat faster, as the servants move back and forward to bring more food and take away empty plates. I phase out for a moment, gagging, and then go back to my meal.

A long line of tribesmen sit one next to each other, slamming their fist on the table and loudly inciting the few contenders to eat faster, as the servants move back and forward to bring more food and take away empty plates. Little by little, some of the contenders tap off, stumbling back and puking on the floor.
午前中、大会の開始を見ようと大勢の人が集まった。最初の暴れ馬が引きずり出されると、競争者は列を作って待った。調教者の1人が前進し、残りの人たちが黙って見守る中、ゆっくりと獣に近づいていく。
午前中、大会の開始を見ようと大勢の人が集まった。最初の暴れ馬が引きずり出されると、競争者は列を作って待った。調教者の1人が前進し、残りの人たちが黙って見守る中、ゆっくりと獣に近づいていく。
日も登り切ったころ、有望な部族の若者数名が最高のドレスと最も貴重な装身具を身に着けて、ロングハウスに集まった。私も彼らの列に加わり、髪の具合を確かめながら競技会の開始を待った。
我々の部族の何人かの有望な若者達は、彼らの最高のドレスと彼らの最も高価な装身具を身に着けて、日も登り切ったころに家に集まった。 群衆が全員揃ったとき、少数の選ばれた審査員は、最初の候補者に前進するよう促した。
試合は早朝から始まった。夜明けまでには、すでに大勢の詩人と若い神童がロングハウスに集まり、準備運動と歌の練習をしている。ついにコンテストが始まり、私は、最初の詩人が歌い始めたのを見ながら参加者たちの中で、私の番を待っている。
試合は早朝から始まった。夜明けまでには、すでに大勢の詩人と若い神童がロングハウスに集まり、準備運動と歌の練習をしている。
試合は早朝から始まった。夜明けまでには、すでに大勢の詩人と若い神童がロングハウスに集まり、準備運動と歌の練習をしている。観客が静まり返り、最初の詩人が歌い始め、ついにコンテストが始まった。
試合は早朝から始まった。夜明けまでには、すでに大勢の詩人と若い神童がロングハウスに集まり、準備運動と歌の練習をしている。観客が静まり返り、最初の詩人が歌い始め、ついにコンテストが始まった。
幾人かの候補者がすでに主な通りの1つに集まっている。ようやく 競争が始まると、我々全員が織機に目を向け、、熱心に機織りを始めた。 我々には、先祖に名誉をもたらすことができるタペストリーを編むための時間は少ししかない。
幾人かの候補者がすでに主な通りの1つに集まっている。ようやく 競争が始まると、候補者全員が織機に目を向け、熱心に機織りを始めた。 彼らには、我々の先祖に名誉をもたらすことができるタペストリーを編むための時間は少ししかない。
もっとも優れたものが勝つ！
最後の対戦相手を数分間組み伏せ、部族全員の歓声が起こる前に勝利を確信する。最後まで立っていた[Root.GetManWoman]として、私が大会の優勝者であることは疑いようのない。
他に相手になるものはいるか！？

With a final strike, [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName] pushes me on the ground, painfully holding me down until I am forced to admit defeat. I have managed to win several fights during the course of the tournament, only to have the final victory stolen from me by this [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman]...

The fights go on for the entire day. When the sun sets, only one [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] remains standing: [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]. The crowd acclaims [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] as the uncontested winner of the tournament, showering [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] with cheers.

I try my best, but, after only a few encounters I am forced to surrender and join the other less fortunate contenders, waiting for the tournament to end. When the sun sets, only one [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] remains standing: [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]. The crowd acclaims [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] as the uncontested winner of the tournament, showering [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] with cheers.
最後の一杯を飲み干したあと、立ち上がるのに召使いの助けが必要だった。視界はぼやけ、思考もまとまらなかったが、他の客人たちが私の名前を歓呼するのを聞いて、私が酒合戦の勝者になったことははっきりとわかった。
みんなグルグルまわってるろぉ？

I hold off as much as I can, but, in the end, I find myself on the ground, covered in mead and spit. I feel as if somebody is striking my skull with a hammer and barely manage to understand anything that is happening around me, but I clearly hear the name of [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName] being repeated over and over by the other tribesmen.

One by one, the contenders tap out, either falling asleep on the ground or stumbling away from the long-house with disgruntled mumblings. There is only one [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] who is left standing at the end: [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]. The tribesmen raise [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] up and parade [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] across the hall, chanting [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis] name.

One by one, the contenders tap out, either falling asleep on the ground or stumbling away from the long-house with disgruntled mumblings. After some time, I am reluctantly forced to join them as well. In the end, there is only one [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] who is left standing: [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]. The tribesmen raise [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] up and parade [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] across the hall, chanting [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis] name.

I throw away the last bone and let out a long sigh, looking at the pile of plates beside me. There is a moment of silence as my only remaining opponents falls down, followed by the cheering of the crowd. Some of the tribesmen try to raise me up, but, after a few failed attempts, they decide to just pat me on the back instead.
Ugh- I need to lay down...

I manage to keep eating long after most other contenders have tapped out, but, unfortunately, as much as I try to, I am unable to keep up with [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName] and, in the end, I have to concede [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] victory, and slide back on the hall's bench, sore and reeling.

One by one, the contenders tap out, either rushing outside, or falling on the ground reeling. There is only one [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] who is left standing at the end: [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]. The tribesmen raise [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] up and parade [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] across the hall, chanting [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis] name.

One by one, the contenders tap out, either rushing outside, or falling on the ground reeling. After some time, I am reluctantly forced to join them as well. In the end, there is only one [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] who is left standing: [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]. The tribesmen raise [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] up and parade [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] across the hall, chanting [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis] name.

The stallion falters and stops resisting, and I lead him on a slow trot near the line of tribesmen witnessing me in silence. When I dismount, I am welcomed by some cheering, but only after about an hour of discussion the group decides that I had proven myself to be the fastest and most resolute amongst the tamers.

Despite avoiding any embarrassing fall, by the end of the day most of the tribesmen who witnessed the contest come to the conclusion that I was not firm and fast enough to deserve to win the tournament. The honor is instead bestowed to [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName].

競技当日、さまざまな競争者が馬から落下して、群衆に嗤われた。最も熟練度の低い調教者が排除された後、初めて真の競争が始まるのだ。夜になって、ちょっとした議論の末に、ほとんどの部族民は、[tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]は、[great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]で最も有能な馬術師であることが証明されたという結論に達した。

Unfortunately, I have barely started to take control over my steed when I am thrown off the saddle and land on my back. With my poor display of skill, I am amongst the first contenders to be eliminated. By the end of the day, after a bit of squabbling, most of the tribesmen come to the conclusion that [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName] has proven to be the most competent horse-tamer of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName].
It was fun while it lasted.

My looks and pose are absolutely impeccable throughout the day. It comes as no surprise when the judges selected for the contest proclaim me to be the fairest [Root.GetManWoman] in [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]. I walk past the other contenders, ignoring their deathly glares and politely thank the crowd.

I was so close to winning. I really thought the judges had taken a liking on me. Unfortunately, at the end of the day it is [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName] the one to be celebrated as fairest [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] in [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName].

候補者たちは、皆に見えるようにメインホールを通って一人ずつ行進した。そして少しずつ、部族の皆は、最も良い若者を選び始めた。 太陽が地平線のふちを舐めるころ、一人の[tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman]だけが残った。[tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]は、最も[great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]の部族の皆の声援を受けた。

One by one, we parade through the main hall for all our tribesmen to see and comment upon, and, little by little, the judges start picking the best of us. Unfortunately, I am not one of the lucky ones. As the sun starts to wane on the horizon, only one [tribal_festival_winner.GetManWoman] is left: [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName], who is cheered as fairest of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName].
[tribal_festival_winner.GetSheHeCap] は魅力的というよりむしろ……

My poem captivates everyone in the long-house. It is thrilling and passionate, featuring epic battles and tragic romances, and leaving everyone holding their breath. Once I conclude my performance, there is little doubt that the prize for best bard of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName] will go to me.
This contest was but a formality.

My poem leaves quite a few mouths hanging, and seems to receive a very good reaction from the guests. Unfortunately, when [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName] starts telling [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis] story, it becomes clear to me that I will not be the winner of this contest.

The contest gives us the opportunity to hear many new amazing stories. Tales of love and war to captivate all the people of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]. In the end, though, the uncontested winner turns out to be [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName], whose epic storytelling skills manage to enthrall the entire town.

The contest gives us the opportunity to hear many new amazing stories. Tales of love and war to captivate all the people of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName]. Unfortunately, the public does not seem to receive well my own poetry, and the uncontested winner turns out to be [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName], whose epic storytelling skills manage to enthrall the entire town.
I had never heard that story...

My voice immediately captivates everyone in the long-house. Not one whisper interrupts my performance, the entire room listens in complete silence. Once I stop singing, I am showered with praise, and immediately proclaimed the winner of the contest.

My song leaves quite a few mouths hanging, and seems to receive a very good reaction from the guests. Unfortunately, when [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName] starts singing [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis], it becomes clear to me that I will not be the winner of this contest.

The contest provides everyone with a very pleasant evening centered around music. Exciting, upbeat pieces alternate with heart-wrenching poems, but nobody amongst the many contenders manages to move the crowd as [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName], whose voice rightfully earns [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] the title of best singer of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName].

The contest provides everyone with a very pleasant evening centered around music. Exciting, upbeat pieces alternate with heart-wrenching poems, but no one amongst us manages to move the crowd as [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName], whose voice rightfully earns [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHim] the title of best singer of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName].

It was an exhausting task. At the end of the day I can barely see straight and I have only little feeling left in my fingers, but the result was far worth all the pain it caused me. My tapestry was acclaimed as the undisputed best piece of artwork anyone in [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName] has ever seen.

I work as fast as I could, but, by the end of the day, I am forced to leave my tapestry unfinished. Despite several of my tribesmen praising my work, its imperfection doomed it to lose the competition to [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]'s masterpiece.

今日作成された多くのタペストリーのうち、[tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]のものほど素晴らしいものはなかった。 [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHisCap]の作品は最も独創的で巧みに作られたものとしてほとんどのゲストから絶賛され、大会における[tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis]の勝利を確実にした。

Unfortunately for me, of the many tapestries created today none is as marvelous as [tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]'s. [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHisCap] work is acclaimed by most guests as the most original and skillfully made, ensuring [tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis] victory in the competition.
見るぶんにはかなり美しいな。
祭りも終わりに近づき、ついに供物を焼いて先祖に捧げ、今後も私たちを守ってくださるよう祈る時が来た。 煙が夜の空に上がると、長い間沈黙が[Root.Capital.GetName]を覆い隠した。その後、我々はシャーマンの指揮で荘厳な賛美歌にを歌い、式を終えた。
祭りの期間が終わると、祭司たちは村の最も神聖な象徴を担いだ信者の行列を先導し、これまでに捧げられたすべての供え物でいっぱいのごみの上に乗せた。長い沈黙の時間が[Root.Capital.GetName]を覆い、聖なる象徴が村の通りをその存在で祝福した後、地元の祠の安全な場所に戻され、儀式は終了した。
祭りも終わりに近づき、ついに供物を焼いて神々に捧げ、今後も私たちを守ってくださるよう祈る時が来た。 煙が夜の空に上がると、長い間沈黙が[Root.Capital.GetName]を覆い隠した。その後、我々はシャーマンの指揮で荘厳な賛美歌を歌い、式を終えた。
祭りも終わりに近づき、ついに供物を焼いて先祖に捧げ、今後も私たちを守ってくださるよう祈る時が来た。 煙が夜の空に上がると、長い間沈黙が[From.Capital.GetName]を覆い隠した。その後、我々はシャーマンの指揮で荘厳な賛美歌を歌い、式を終えた。
祭りの期間が終わると、祭司たちは村の最も神聖な象徴を担いだ信者の行列を先導し、これまでに捧げられたすべての供え物でいっぱいのごみの上に乗せた。長い沈黙の時間が[From.Capital.GetName]を覆い、聖なる象徴が村の通りをその存在で祝福した後、地元の祠の安全な場所に戻され、儀式は終了した。
祭りも終わりに近づき、いよいよ古い神々に捧げるために供え物に火をつけ、彼らがこれからの数年間にわたり私たちを守るように祈る時だ。 煙が夜の空に昇ると、長い沈黙の時間が[From.Capital.GetName]を覆い、シャーマンたちは私たちを陰鬱な賛美歌で導いて、式典を終えた。
§Y一斉改宗§!が進行中の一方で§Y最高の部族組織法§!に満たないと、§Y原始宗教の封臣§!が新宗教を拒絶する危険性が高まります。
The recent mass conversion of this province's owner has attracted new merchants from the more civilized parts of the world, revitalizing local trade.
The new clergy of this realm is attempting to sway the remaining pagan converts to fully embrace the new faith.
Following the recent mass conversion, a number of experienced craftsmen from more civilized lands have reached this province to offer their services to the locals.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been suggesting for a few days now that, as a [Root.Religion.GetName] ruler, I am no longer under any obligation to allow the other Chieftains to determine how to divide my own lands once I die. [From.GetSheHeCap] assures me that I am well within my right to pass down my titles directly to my children.
No, we must keep this tradition.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] thinks that, by spreading the word about my recent conversion to other [Root.Religion.GetName] realms, I will be able to significantly increase the prosperity of [Root.Capital.GetName].
We need to attract more traders.
Do you know of other missionaries?
I wish to have more experienced craftsmen.
No, I do not want to risk upsetting my people.

There are many valuable texts that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [From.GetHerHim] when moving to [Root.Capital.GetName]. Today, [From.GetSheHe] asked me if I was interested in learning more about [Root.Religion.GetName] arts and laws.
Yes, tell me more about your lawmakers.
Yes, tell me more about your crafts.
Yes, tell me more about your legends.

After having examined the state of [Root.Capital.GetName], [From.GetTitledFirstName] assures me that there are several ways in which I can improve our way of life, simply by adopting some of the tools and laws followed by most [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers.

I have heard [From.GetTitledFirstName] talking about the customs of other [From.Religion.GetName] [From.Culture.GetName] rulers for quite some time now since [From.GetHerHis] arrival, to the point that I have started to feel allured by some of the customs of the [From.Culture.GetName] people, just as much as I was of their religion...
I wish to be a [From.Culture.GetName] too!
No, I must preserve our ancient traditions.

A group of militant faithful have come to [Root.Capital.GetName], attracted by the sermons of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Although foreigners, these warriors appear to be willing to join my army and help me spread the word of [Root.Religion.GetName].
I cannot allow foreign troops within my realm!
あなたは§Y魅力的§!であるためこれが選択可能です
あなたは無口であるため、これが選択可能です
今宵の集会所、上機嫌な私は腕相撲で勝負がしたくてうずうずしていた。主だった戦士たちが、狩りの祝いに大ホールに集まれば、私の力を試す戦士たちには事欠かない。
挑戦者の中で一番強い奴と対決しよう!
[arm_wrestling_opponent_2.GetFirstName]は相手としてちょうど良さそうだ。
危ない橋は渡りたくない...
考え直して、代わりに一杯やろう。
最近の狩りを祝うために、多くの重要な戦士たちが今夜集会所に集まっていた。私がようやく友人の何人かと祝祭に参加したとき、[From.GetTitledFirstName]が押し入り、[From.GetSheHe]が私の2倍の強さであると主張し、それを証明するために私に腕相撲を挑戦した。
Refuse §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s challenge.\nYour fellow §YWarriors§! will remember this cowardly act.
私の挑戦を受けるには、[From.GetTitledFirstName]はあまりに臆病者だった。[From.GetSheHeCap]は言い訳すると、私と腕比べをせずに大急ぎでホールを後にした。
[From.GetFirstName]と私は互いの前に座り、試合の準備をしている。別の戦士がまだ私達の拳を押さえている間、私達は腕を机の上に置く。周りの群衆はばらばらにカウントダウンを歌い、私達が互いに押し合い始めると歓声をあげた。

ゆっくりと、しかし確実に[arm_wrestling_fighter_2.GetFirstName]は倒していく。少しずつ、少しずつ、[arm_wrestling_fighter_2.GetSheHe]は私の手の甲を押してテーブルに近づけている。私は呼吸を忘れ始め、顔は赤くなり、汗が滝のように流れ、それでも[arm_wrestling_fighter_2.GetHerHis]の手を押し返すことができない。ただただ私にはこの対決に勝てるだけの強さがなかったのかもしれない……。

ゆっくりと、しかし確実に[arm_wrestling_fighter_1.GetFirstName]は倒していく。少しずつ、少しずつ、[arm_wrestling_fighter_1.GetSheHe]は私の手の甲を押してテーブルに近づけている。私は呼吸を忘れ始め、顔は赤くなり、汗が滝のように流れ、それでも[arm_wrestling_fighter_1.GetHerHis]の手を押し返すことができない。ただただ私にはこの対決に勝てるだけの強さがなかったのかもしれない……。
おおっと、肘が滑ってしまった。
あっ！後ろに何かいるぞ！？
不正によってチャンスを得ることを試みる。
少しの間だが、勝利は確実なものだと思えた。私はゆっくりと[From.GetFirstName]の手の甲をテーブルに近づけていく。しかし、突然に地力を取り戻して、[From.GetHerHis]の手は元の位置に戻り、反対側に押し返し始めた。
肘を動かすんじゃない、このペテン師め！

Slowly but surely, I manage to push [From.GetFirstName]'s hand closer and closer to the table. I grit my teeth and chuckle, glancing at my opponent to revel in my imminent victory. [From.GetFirstName] looks back at me with a smile. [From.GetSheHeCap] is leaning forward, trying to push back, and giving me a good view of her sweaty cleavage.

Slowly but surely, I manage to push [From.GetFirstName]'s hand closer and closer to the table. I grit my teeth and chuckle, glancing at my opponent to revel in my imminent victory. [From.GetFirstName] looks back at me with a smile and winks at me, making my heart skip a beat.
I only care about my beloved.
Pfh! You have picked the wrong person!

Things are not looking great for [From.GetFirstName]. I am slowly managing to get [From.GetHerHis] knuckles on the table, despite [From.GetHerHis] best efforts to push my hand back. When [From.GetSheHe] suddenly shouts a semi-coherent warning about something dangerous behind me, I am baffled.
Do you think I am that stupid?
ドシンという大きな音と共に、私は[wl_arm_wrestling_loser.GetFirstName]の拳を机に叩きつけ、周りを囲む他の戦士たちの歓声のシャワーを聞いた。対戦相手は私を睨み、[wl_arm_wrestling_loser.GetSheHe]は[wl_arm_wrestling_loser.GetHerHis]の手を擦りながら、敗北を受け入れることについてぼそぼそと言っていた。
貴方はどれだけ弱いの？
§Y[wl_arm_wrestling_loser.GetTitledFirstName]§!は侮辱に対して§Y決闘§!を挑むかもしれません。
§Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!は雪辱を晴らすための§Y決闘§!を貴方に申し込むかもしれません。
そんなに自分を責めるな！
ドシンという大きな音と共に、[wl_arm_wrestling_winner.GetFirstName]は私の拳を机に叩きつけ、周りを囲む他の戦士たちの歓声のシャワーを聞いた。私を倒しただけでは飽き足らず、[wl_arm_wrestling_winner.GetSheHe]は公然と私を嘲笑した。
本当の強さを見せてやる！
あなたの仲間の戦士たちがあなたを笑っています。

ドシンという大きな音と共に、[wl_arm_wrestling_winner.GetFirstName]は私の拳を机に叩きつけ、周りを囲む他の戦士たちの歓声のシャワーを聞いた。幸いにも、[wl_arm_wrestling_winner.GetFirstName]は勝利を誇示しないことを決め、[wl_arm_wrestling_winner.GetHerHim]に対する多くの賞賛の中、私に少しの賞賛をくれた。
もっと精進しなければ……

It has been some time now since I have begun noticing [From.GetFirstName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] has distinguished [From.GetHerselfHimself] more than once amongst the members of our Lodge, to the point that I have started feeling strangely attracted to [From.GetHerHim].
I wonder if [From.GetSheHe] feels the same...
Approach §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! and declare your feelings for [From.GetHerHim].

Tonight, just as I was about to leave the main hall, I was approached by [From.GetFirstName], one of my fellow warriors. After chatting for a while, [From.GetSheHe] reveals to me that [From.GetSheHe] has been watching me for a while, and finds me to be a very strong and attractive fighter.
And I happen to think the same about you.
Thanks, but I am not interested.

I was right to trust my feelings. [From.GetFirstName] was surprised and happy to hear of how I felt about [From.GetHerHim] and told me that [From.GetSheHe] was merely waiting for the right opportunity to reveal [From.GetHerHis] own feelings for me.

Unfortunately, [From.GetFirstName] has spurned my advances without much thought to it. At first, I hoped that [From.GetSheHe] was simply misunderstanding my intentions, but, after a bit of discussing, [From.GetSheHe] flatly told me that [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in me.
よくもまあ拒否できたものだな！

It has been some time now since I have begun noticing [From.GetFirstName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] has distinguished [From.GetHerselfHimself] more than once amongst the members of our Lodge. [From.GetSheHeCap] is, without a doubt, an impressive warrior.

Tonight, just as I was about to leave the main hall, I was approached by [From.GetFirstName], one of my fellow warriors. After chatting for a while, [From.GetSheHe] reveals to me that [From.GetSheHe] has been watching me for a while, and has come to consider me one of the most valuable members of the Lodge, as well as a terrific fighter.
Thanks. I feel the same about you, [From.GetFirstName].
That is very flattering of you...
[From.GetFirstName] was glad to hear of what I think of [From.GetHerHim]. We spent most of the night talking and ended up declaring our friendship to each other after a long series of toasts.
I couldn't ask for a better friend, [From.GetFirstName]!

Unfortunately, [From.GetFirstName]'s reception to my thoughts about [From.GetHerHim] was tepid at best. We talked for a while, but it soon became clear that we do not have as much in common as I initially thought.

§Y信仰点§!を消費して[Root.RelHead.GetTitle]にあなたの領地へ多額の資金援助を依頼します。\n[Root.RelHead.GetTitle]は応えられない要求や最近債務した者からの依頼には応じません。

§Y信仰点§!を消費し、[Root.RelHead.GetTitle]に他の[Root.Religion.GetName]支配者への§Y侵略§!を是認してもらいます。\n[Root.RelHead.GetTitle]は大領主からの要求や弱小領主への侵攻は許可しません。
§Y信仰点§!と§Y威信§!を消費することで、[Root.RelHead.GetTitle]に配偶者との離婚の許可を要求します。

To [Root.GetTitledName],
We have taken note of your passionate plea for forgiveness, and We are certain that you will be eager to prove the sincerity of your repentance by paying the proper price for your indulgence.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]
無駄遣いする金はない！
After paying the requested tribute to the Holy See, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has finally agreed to lift my Excommunication and welcome me back into the loving embrace of the Holy Mother Church.

After paying the requested tribute to [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has finally agreed to lift my Excommunication, restoring my legitimacy as [Root.GetTitle] in the eyes of the [Root.Religion.GetName] world.

[Root.GetTitledName]へ
貴方の赦しを求める情熱溢れる嘆願について聞かせてもらった。その悔いに偽りがないことへの証として、我々の前で告解を行うことを約束してほしい。

敬具
[From.GetTitledName]
私に恥をかかせる気か！
頭に灰を被ったまま泥の中で三日間を過ごし、足を引きずるようにして[FromFrom.GetTitle]の聖なる宮殿へ赴き、[FromFrom.GetFirstName]の前に出た。[FromFrom.GetHerHis]は許しを与えて私の破門を解き、聖母教会の教えに再び戻ってきたことを暖かく迎えた。

I am forced to spend three days in the mud, with my head covered in ash, dragging myself towards the [FromFrom.GetTitle]'s holy palace before [FromFrom.GetFirstName] finally decides to grant me [FromFrom.GetHerHis] forgiveness, lifting my Excommunication and restoring my legitimacy as [Root.GetTitle] in the eyes of the [Root.Religion.GetName] world.
これほど恥ずかしい思いはしたことがない…

[Root.GetTitledName]へ
貴方の赦しを求める情熱溢れる嘆願について聞かせてもらった。貴公のその悔いに偽りがないことへの証として、生涯独身でいることを[From.Religion.GetHighGodName]に誓ってくれると確信している。

敬具
[From.GetTitledName]
なんだと！？そんな事をするものか！
[FromFrom.GetTitle]は、過去の罪に対して厳格な禁欲の誓いを立てて懺悔することが必要だと言った。自由にふるまうことで私は美徳から離れていったという主張だ。
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] cannot possibly know what I do every night...
本当にそれで良かったのだろうか？

[Root.GetTitledName]へ
貴方の赦しを求める情熱溢れる嘆願について聞かせてもらった。その悔いに偽りがないことへの証として、貴公の子供のうち一人の人生を[From.Religion.GetHighGodName]に捧げてくれると確信している。

敬具
[From.GetTitledName]

The [FromFrom.GetTitle] has determined that the price for my wickedness is the life of my [son_monk_candidate.GetSonDaughter] [son_monk_candidate.GetFirstName]. [son_monk_candidate.GetSheHeCap] will take [son_monk_candidate.GetHerHis] leave [Root.Capital.GetName] to become a [son_monk_candidate.GetManWoman] of the cloth.
How could I do this to [son_monk_candidate.GetHerHim]?
I am sure [son_monk_candidate.GetSheHe] will learn to like it.

To [Root.GetTitledName],
We fear that your infractions are far too severe to be forgiven by a simple act of contrition. If you care for the salvation of your soul, you will relinquish your throne, which your wicked deeds have irredeemably soiled, and devote yourself to [From.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]
If this is the price I have to pay...

I never realized it would come to this until it was too late. To cleanse my sins I have to abdicate my own throne. Stripped of all my titles, I will have to live a life of deprivation, cloistered in a monastery, far from all my friends and relatives.
I can only hope my successor will do better...

[Root.GetTitledName]へ
貴方の赦しを求める情熱溢れる嘆願について聞かせてもらった。その悔いに偽りがないことへの証として、貴公が領民に課した、教会の正当な権利を奪う、かの不信心な布告を取り消してくれると期待している。

敬具
[From.GetTitledName]
これは私の領土だ。そして、「私の」司祭たちだ！
私の赦免の代償は、[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]の司教叙任権の復活である。つまり、私の領域内で司教を叙任する権限を持つのは[FromFrom.GetTitle]だけである。
私の赦免の代償は、[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]の司教叙任権の復活である。つまり、私の領域内で司教を叙任する権限を持つのは[FromFrom.GetTitle]だけである。
他にどうすればよかったんだ？

To [Root.GetTitledName],
We are of the opinion that it was your hubris and selfish thirst for power that have led you on the path of wickedness. As such, we demand that, in exchange for your absolution, you show your humility by equally dividing your realm amongst your heirs.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

It is decree of the Holy See that my titles be split upon my death equally amongst my children. The very integrity of my realm is a steep price to pay to receive absolution for my past sins and be able to rejoin my fellow [Root.Religion.GetName] subjects.

It is decree of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] that my titles be split upon my death equally amongst my children. The very integrity of my realm is a steep price to pay to receive absolution for my past sins and be able to rejoin my fellow [Root.Religion.GetName] subjects.

[Root.GetTitledName]へ
貴方の赦しを求める情熱溢れる嘆願について聞かせてもらった。その悔いに偽りがないことへの証として、貴公がイタリアの地にいくつか所持している、我々の古くからの正当なる請求権を返してくれると信じている。

敬具
[From.GetTitledName]
ダメだ、今は私の土地だ！

With the restoration of the Papal State's ancient borders, the Pope has finally seen fit to absolve me from my past sins and lift the Excommunication that [From.GetSheHe] had placed upon me. I can now rejoin the Holy Mother Church in peace.

[Root.GetTitledName]へ
貴方の赦しを求める情熱溢れる嘆願について聞かせてもらった。貴公のその悔いに偽りがないことへの証として、帝国内での教会の主権について公式に認めてくれると信じている。

敬具
[From.GetTitledName]
だめだ、そのような不服従は認めない！

In order to receive absolution from my sins, I am required to recognize the authority that the Holy See has over me in the first place. As such, I was forced to relinquish [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] from my control, granting [FromFrom.GetHerHim] full power over [FromFrom.GetHerHis] lands.

In order to receive absolution from my sins, I am required to recognize the authority that [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has over me in the first place. As such, I was forced to relinquish [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] from my control, granting [FromFrom.GetHerHim] full power over [FromFrom.GetHerHis] lands.

To [Root.GetTitledName],
We are of the opinion that only by returning under the rightful lead of the Holy See you will be able to find absolution for your sins. Your lands rightfully belong to the Church, and we therefore demand that you submit to Our benevolent authority forthwith.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]
I will not bow to you!

The Holy See claims direct dominion over all of Italy since the Donation of Emperor Pepin. Although [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] had gained independence in recent times, I am now forced to bow to the throne of Saint Peter in order to find absolution for my transgression.

[convert_lord_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has been insisting for a while now that a baptism requires me to adopt a new, proper [Root.Religion.GetName] name in order to truly prove my newfound faith in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

[convert_lord_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has been insisting for a while now that a conversion requires me to adopt a new, proper [Root.Religion.GetName] name in order to truly prove my newfound faith in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Nonsense. I will not forsake my own name!

Under pressure from [From.GetHerHis] new priest, my [GetFromRelation] has decided to adopt a new name after [From.GetHerHis] recent conversion and now calls [From.GetHerselfHimself] [From.GetFirstName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] has invited all of [From.GetHerHis] family to follow [From.GetHerHim] in this chance to fully embrace the new religion.
Nonsense. I will not forsake my own name!
A conversion to the [Root.Religion.GetName] demands the adoption of a new name as a proof that I have thoroughly forsaken the old, heathen traditions of my ancestors.

A few of my fellow warriors have been spending the night at the Lodge, playing dice games while drinking. Noticing me watching them, they immediately invite me to join them. Initially, I refuse, but then they start teasing me, insinuating I am afraid of a simple betting game.
Alright, then! Pass me the die!
As I take the four-sided die inscribed with the intricate faces of the gods, I am asked how much I wish to bet before starting the game.
I am feeling rather lucky tonight.
This is as much as I am willing to go.
I am only playing for fun...
As I take the four-sided die inscribed with the intricate faces of the gods, I wonder who should I put my faith in. Some combinations will reward me more than others, yet they are harder to come by.
Having set all the bets, the warriors gathered around the table incite me to throw the die, eager to see what face will come up.
Luckily, I am using my weighted die.
you successfully tricking the other warriors.
Surely, nobody will notice a bump under the table...
the other warriors noticing that you are trying to cheat.
being unable to push the die properly.

My attempt to change the regular die with a weighted one did not pass unnoticed. After a bit of squabbling, one of the other fighters manages to pick the die away from me and throws it on the table a few times, revealing my intent.
How dare you call me a cheat!
Start a §YDuel§! with §Y[random_society_winner.GetFirstName]§! to avoid paying your debt.
Was there any doubt that [Root.GetWLDieBetName] would come up when I am using my lucky die? A chorus of cheers and groans accompany the result of the game and money is exchanged.
Let's go again! Double or nothing!
We should do this more often.
Unfortunately, I was too indiscreet with my leg, and several warriors noticed my attempt to move the die after it was cast. After a bit of squabbling, I am forced to accept defeat and pay up.
I wasn't doing anything, I swear!
Despite the other warriors not noticing me kneeing the table, fate played me for a fool and I ended up accidentally pushing the die away from [Root.GetWLDieBetName], much to my disappointment.
With just a little help, my die rolled exactly as I hoped it would, landing to show [Root.GetWLDieBetName]. A chorus of cheers and groans accompany the result of the game and money is exchanged.
Let's go again! Double or nothing!
We should do this more often.
A moment of silence falls upon our group as the die rolls from my hand and bounces a few times on the table, rolling to a halt to show the face of [Root.GetWLDieName].
Yes! Let's go again, double or nothing!
Start a §YDuel§! with §Y[random_society_winner.GetFirstName]§! to avoid paying your debt.

After the money from the first bets exchanges hands, I pick up the die and cast it again, trying to throw it exactly in the same way. The die rolls around the table and finally stops, showing the face of [Root.GetWLDieName].
I confidently throw my lucky die a second time and to the chagrin of all the other warriors, collect all bets a second time.
I let the die bounce on the table twice and, just as it is about to stop, I give a little nudge to the table, ensuring my victory a second time.
§Y[tribal_festival_winner.GetFirstName]§!の快挙を称え、[tribal_festival_winner.GetHerHis]の祖先を称える賞を贈ります。
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to give me a large sum of money for my performance during the festival, praising me in front of all the tribesmen gathered in [From.Capital.GetName].
This option is available because §Y[From.GetFirstName]§! is your §Y[GetFromRelation]§!
あなたの方が§Y[From.GetFirstName]§!より優れているので、これが選択可能です
あなたは§Y家族§!を愛しているため、この選択肢が利用可能です
今夜は大広間に多くの戦士が集まった。夕食は始まったばかりだが、私は度胸試しの相手を見つけることに夢中だった。すでに何度かの舌戦を行い、私の相手として相応しい粗野で辛辣な候補を見つけた。
最も優れた話者に挑もう！
簡単な戦いが望ましい。

Right in the middle of a dinner, [From.GetTitledFirstName] calls my name from the other side of the dining hall, standing on one of the long tables. [From.GetSheHeCap] challenges me to a Flyting, encouraging me to stand up and prepare myself to be thoroughly humiliated.
I am not in the mood right now.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to refuse my challenge. Muttering some poor excuse about not being in the mood for insulting anyone, the [From.GetManWoman] shrinks back in the crowd, amongst the derision of all the other warriors in the room.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] takes a last drink and throws away [From.GetHerHis] tankard. [From.GetSheHeCap] stands up in front of me, claiming that [From.GetSheHe] is ready to turn me in the laughing stock of [Root.Society.GetName].
Go ahead, then! I will let you start.
私は席を立ち、食堂で[From.GetFirstName]の名前を叫ぶことで、多くの戦士の注目を集めて、[From.GetHerHim]に舌戦を挑んだ。今、決めるべきことは[From.GetFirstName]をより挑発できる話題だ。
[From.GetTitledFirstName]はダイニングホールの反対側から私の名を呼び、ロングテーブルを挟んで舌戦を挑もうとしている。[Root.GetProwessInsultDesc]
I think my accomplishments speak for themselves...
Oh, I wouldn't know about that, [From.GetFirstName]...
I have no idea what you are talking about!
あなたを嘲笑う声が聞こえてくる。
[From.GetTitledFirstName]はダイニングホールの反対側から私の名を呼び、ロングテーブルを挟んで舌戦を挑もうとしている。[Root.GetCharacterInsultDesc]
I have no problem admitting my flaws.
そんなことは全くない！
How dare you say it! That's not my fault!
[From.GetTitledFirstName]はダイニングホールの反対側から私の名を呼び、ロングテーブルを挟んで舌戦を挑もうとしている。[Root.GetAccomplishmentsInsultDesc]
Meh, not that I care either way...
Oh, we shall see about that!
[From.GetTitledFirstName]はダイニングホールの反対側から私の名を呼び、ロングテーブルを挟んで舌戦を挑もうとしている。[Root.GetFamilyInsultDesc]
あえてか！もうたくさんだ！
This is so mean of you!
Isn't this supposed to be a game?
あえてか！もうたくさんだ！
As if I cared about what you think.
This is so mean of you!
Isn't this supposed to be a game?
しばらく言い争ったが、戦士たちの笑い声によって[From.GetFirstName]の顔は怒りと恥ずかしさで真っ赤になっている。もはや意味が通じる回答ができておらず、言い争う気力を完全に失っている。
子供の様な真似はやめるんだな！
おふざけが過ぎてしまった、[From.GetFirstName]よ、怒らないでくれ。
私は平静さを失った。私が[From.GetFirstName]の侮辱に反論出来なかったのを見るや、観衆は[From.GetHerHim]の味方となり、[From.GetHerHis]の勝利は確かなものとなった。私が敗北を認めても[From.GetFirstName]はまだ足りないと侮辱し続け、私は失ったものの恥ずかしさを受け入れるしかなかった。
発言を撤回させてやる！
これが最後だ！今から私たちは敵同士だからな！
怒り狂うあなたを見て他の戦士たちは笑っている。
こんな馬鹿馬鹿しいお遊びをもうたくさんだ！

I lost my temper. Seeing that I was unable to rebuke [From.GetFirstName]'s insults, the crowd quickly sided with [From.GetHerHim] ensuring [From.GetHerHis] victory. At the very least, after I admit defeat, [From.GetFirstName] calms me down and orders a drink for both of us, ensuring that it was all done in good fun and it was not [From.GetHerHis] intention to seriously offend me.
The other warriors mock you for your pettiness as you storm out.

Perhaps I shouldn't have treated [From.GetFirstName] so poorly. Right after the game, [From.GetSheHe] swore revenge for [From.GetHerHis] humiliation and stormed off the main hall, amongst the laughter of all the other warriors.
Can the [From.GetManWoman] not take a joke?

Despite my show of kindness, [From.GetFirstName] refused to drink with me after the game. Instead, [From.GetSheHe] swore revenge for [From.GetHerHis] humiliation and stormed off the main hall, amongst the laughter of all the other warriors.

Our cellar has had a growing excess of mead for a few weeks now, to the point that I am starting to think about challenging the other warriors of the Lodge to see whom amongst them has the toughest stomach, while at the same time freeing some space and improving the fighters' morale.
Why not? Let the celebrations begin!
Hold and oversee a §YDrinking Contest§! amongst your fellow warriors.
That seems like such a waste...
今晩、[From.GetBestName]は全ての会員で飲み交わすために蜂蜜酒を用意して、仲間の戦士で誰が最も酒を飲んでも落ち着いていられるか見極めようとしている。
二日酔いは避けた方がいいだろう。

は奴隷として売られた
The local garrison has been depleted to help the efforts of a righteous Crusade.
いなくなった農民たち
A good portion of the local population has left the field to join a Crusade.
This ruler has vowed to support the Children's Crusade economically, helping the young zealots in their efforts to restore the Holy Land to Christendom.
The crusaders have reached the Holy Land scattered, starving and desperate, with barely any hope left to conquer Jerusalem.
The many difficulties encountered during their long travel has all but extinguished the crusaders' hopes to reconquer the Holy Land.
The many difficulties encountered during their long travel has all but extinguished the crusaders' hopes to reconquer the Holy Land.
The many difficulties encountered during their long travel has all but extinguished the crusaders' hopes to reconquer the Holy Land.
Despite the many difficulties encountered during their long travel, the crusaders' fervor has not dimmed as they reached the gates of the Kingdom of Heaven.
神の声を聞いたと主張する[Root.GetBoyGirl]に率いられた農民と子どもたちによる大軍は、邪教徒から聖地を取り戻すという無謀な使命に乗り出した。
You will now play as §Y[From.GetTitledName]§! instead of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.

I have received a vision from the Holy Ghost.\nOur Lord has ordered me to take up arms, rally the faithful and march on the Holy Land to take it away from the vile grasp of the infidels desecrating its hallowed grounds.
すぐに出発しなければ！

I feared that my [GetFromRelation]'s desire to free the Holy Land would lead [From.GetHerHim] to an unfortunate end.\n[From.GetFirstName] is gone. All the children and peasants who had flocked to [From.GetHerHis] banner have scattered to the four winds. They lament the loss of their beloved leader, still unable to grasp why would God allow [From.GetHerHim] to be killed before accomplishing [From.GetHerHis] divine task.\nYet, I can at least take the solace in the fact that, as unfortunate as [From.GetFirstName]'s death was, it has undoubtedly saved the lives of countless people, who would have otherwise followed the child into the maws of certain doom at the hands of the infidels.

With the death of [From.GetFirstName], [From.GetHerHis] misguided attempt to lead a Crusade to the Holy Land will never come to pass. All the children and peasants who had flocked to the banner of this [From.GetBoyGirl] have scattered to the four winds. They lament the loss of their beloved leader, still unable to grasp why would God allow [From.GetHerHim] to be killed before accomplishing [From.GetHerHis] divine task.\nAs unfortunate as [From.GetFirstName]'s death was, it has undoubtedly saved the lives of countless people, who would have otherwise followed the child into the maws of certain doom at the hands of the infidels.

By permanently getting rid of [From.GetFirstName], I have ensured that [From.GetHerHis] misguided attempt to lead a Crusade to the Holy Land will never come to pass. All the children and peasants who had flocked to the banner of this [From.GetBoyGirl] have scattered to the four winds. They lament the loss of their beloved leader, still unable to grasp why would God allow [From.GetHerHim] to meet an untimely end before accomplishing [From.GetHerHis] divine task.\nAs unfortunate as [From.GetFirstName]'s fate was, it has undoubtedly saved the lives of countless people, who would have otherwise followed the child into the maws of certain doom at the hands of the infidels.
Such a violent end, for such a young [From.GetBoyGirl]...

By capturing [From.GetFirstName], I have put a stop to [From.GetHerHis] misguided attempt to lead a Crusade to the Holy Land.\n\nThe child languished in my dungeons, and [From.GetHerHis] foolish followers have already started to scatter to the four winds, unable to fathom why God would allow their beloved leader to be stopped so easily.
[From.GetSheHeCap] will stay locked until [From.GetSheHe] has learned [From.GetHerHis] lesson.

With the untimely capture of [From.GetFirstName] by [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetBoyGirl]'s attempt to lead a horde of zealots to recapture the Holy Land for Christendom has been foiled. The child's followers have swiftly scattered to the four winds after the loss of their beloved leader, unable to comprehend why God would allow [From.GetFirstName] to be stopped so easily before succeeding in [From.GetHerHis] divine quest.

Something has happened to my beloved [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName].

[From.GetSheHeCap] claims that the Holy Ghost visited [From.GetHerHim] last night, ordering [From.GetHerHim] to take up arms, gather all the true followers and lead a Crusade against the infidels who are desecrating the hallowed soil of Jerusalem.

[From.GetSheHeCap] has even had the gall to demand money, weapons and troops from me to show my support to this sacred quest of [From.GetHersHis]. [From.GetSheHeCap] will not listen to reason and is very determined to leave [Root.Capital.GetName] immediately.

[From.GetFirstName], a child from [Root.Capital.GetName] has caused quite the commotion today, when [From.GetSheHe] demanded an audience with me, claiming that the Holy Ghost appeared to [From.GetHerHim] in dream last night, ordering [From.GetHerHim] to take up arms, gather all the true followers of Christ and lead a Crusade to free the Holy Land.\n\n[From.GetSheHeCap] concluded [From.GetHerHis] sermon by commanding me to provide [From.GetHerHim] with money, weapons and men to help [From.GetHerHim] fight against the infidels in the name of Our Lord.
[childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName]の§Y十字軍§!が成功を収めるよう、出来る限りの支援を行う。
I will dispatch some men to protect you.
Pledge some troops to join [childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName]'s Crusade and protect the child during [childrens_crusade_leader.GetHerHis] perilous journey.
長旅のための食料をいくらか提供しよう。
Oh, absolutely! I will ship you to the holy land myself!
Trick [childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName] and [childrens_crusade_leader.GetHerHis] supporters and have them sold into slavery to the heathens.
You are dead to me. Leave and never return!
Guards! Throw this blithering fools out!
If this is what you desire, I will not hold you.
Do whatever you wish, it is of no concern to me.

[FromFrom.Capital.GetName]の[FromFrom.GetBoyGirl]が、一刻も早く武器を取り、キリストの真の信者を集め、エルサレムの聖地を冒涜する邪教徒に対して十字軍を率いるよう、聖霊からお告げを受けたという一報が届きました 。\n[FromFrom.GetBoyGirl]は、農民の間で多くの信者を集めて、[FromFrom.GetHerHis]が進軍すれば海そのものが道を開くと主張して、聖地に到達するための偉大な旅に乗り出しました。
子供とはいえ、なんと粗野な夢想をするものだ…
May [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] show [childrens_crusade_leader.GetHerHim] the way to victory!
この子どもたちは主の御言葉を伝える使者なのか？

The ragtag army of [childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName] has reached [Root.Capital.GetName]. As if the parade of dirty peasants and screeching children hadn't already caused enough problems, their unlikely leader has requested an audience with me, claiming that I should provide supplies and lodging for [childrens_crusade_leader.GetHerHis] holy warriors.
Your words have moved me! I will support you.
Oh, I will find you a place to stay...
Guards! Remove these urchins from the premises!
I am afraid we have no food to spare.
[childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName]の寄せ集めの軍が[Root.Capital.GetName]に到達した。汚れた農民と喚き散らす子供たちのパレードはすでに十分な問題を引き起こしているというのに、彼らのリーダーとはとても思えないその人物は、聖なる探求のために軍隊と軍備を提供すべきだと、私と一緒にそこにいる観客たちに要求している。
要求を上回るような支援をしてやろう！
よろしい、兵士を何人か与えよう。
我が臣民に、そなたの探求に興味があるものがいるかどうか尋ねてみるがよい。
Do not worry, I know just who to call...
絶望的な探求に手助けに出せる兵士などいないと思う。

Ever since the ragtag army of [childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName] has reached [Root.Capital.GetName], I have received no shortage of complaints from [child_outraged_priest.GetTitledFirstName] regarding how heretical this Crusade is, and how I should make an example of its young leader to prevent my subjects from falling to [childrens_crusade_leader.GetHerHis] sinful words.
But [childrens_crusade_leader.GetSheHe] is the chosen of Our Lord!
Worry not, [child_outraged_priest.GetFirstName]. I will make these pesky children disappear.
I will have my guards beat them out of [Root.Capital.GetName].
Let us not concern ourselves with them, shall we?

Ever since the ragtag army of [childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName] has reached [Root.Capital.GetName], I felt drawn to the words of its leader. Jesus surely speaks for [childrens_crusade_leader.GetHerHim].

Tragedy has struck me! My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], swayed by the words of [childrens_crusade_leader.GetFirstName], has decided to flee [From.GetHerHis] home to join the Children's Crusade.
I must follow them to protect my [GetFromRelation]!
How could [From.GetSheHe] do this to me!

[From.GetFirstName]は、[From.GetHerHis]の戦士が無傷のまま渡り、聖地まで行進できるように、軍隊の到着時に地中海が左右に裂けると主張した。\n残念なことに、リーダーはは若い十字軍に対する約束を果たせず、今では農民や子供たちの大きな力はジェノバで衰え、アジアへの旅の道を探している。\nそれほど熱心ではない十字軍のメンバーの中にはすでに信仰を失っている者もいるが、[From.GetFirstName]は信念を強く持っており、毎日新しく増える絶望し始めた人々を説得している。
They could use more troops for protection.
I will allocate some resources to help them buy a passage.
I can spare some money to send them some food.
I will pray that they soon find a passage.
まだ家に帰ろうと思えば帰れる。
ついに聖地にたどり着くために地中海を渡る船を予約することに成功した後、少年十字軍は恐ろしい嵐に会い、船はアカイアの海岸で沈没し、不幸にもギリシャに迂回することを余儀なくされた。多くの人が[From.GetFirstName]のリーダーシップを疑い始めているという噂があるが、軍からの報告はあまりない。\n\nそれでも、若者や農民のありえないほど大きな集団はまだエルサレムに向かって進んでいる。
They are surely in need of more supplies!
I must reiterate my support to strengthen [From.GetFirstName]'s authority.
I will dispatch letters to the local authorities to send them on the correct path.
I can only hope they will persevere.
おそらく主は彼らが聖地に達することを望んではいないのだろう…
ニカイアの少年十字軍

すべての逆境と、神からの影響を受けたリーダーシップを弱体化させる多くの試みにもかかわらず、[From.GetFirstName]は軍をニカイアまでの道をすべて行進させることができた。\n聖地がついに手の届く範囲に入ったので、十字軍の決意は強まった。邪教徒が彼らの聖なる使命を理解したならば、彼らに対してあえて手出しはしないだろうし、その代わりにエルサレムの門戸が到着時に開かれるはずであると、リーダーは確信している。

Despite all adversities and many attempts to undermine [From.GetHerHis] divinely-inspired leadership, [From.GetFirstName] has been able to march [From.GetHerHis] army all the way to Nikaea. \nWith the Holy Land finally within reach, the Crusaders' resolve has been strengthened. \n[From.GetFirstName] has sent me a message, thanking me for my continued support during the campaign, and asking me any further help I am able to provide [From.GetHerHim] with in order to prevail against the infidels. With my help and God's blessing, [From.GetSheHe] is certain of victory against the abominable heathens.
When the time comes, I will join in battle with you!
I will allocate more resources to support your fight.
I can only offer you my most sincere prayers.
There is not much else I can do, I fear.
どうやってまだ進んでいるのか？
アンティオキアの天使たち

大天使ガブリエルの幻影を受け取ってから、十字軍国家群に至る危険な道を通って軍を導くのをその幻影が手伝っていたのか、[From.GetFirstName]の少年十字軍は、奇妙なことに、邪教徒によって発見される前にアンティオキアに到着することができた。\n邪教徒は戦いの必要なしに十字軍の到着時に悪魔崇拝を捨てるだろうという、[From.GetBoyGirl]の主張にもかかわらず、エルサレムを占領していた異教徒たちは軍隊を動員し始め、悪しき土地を守るために彼らに向かって行進している無邪気な魂たちを虐殺する準備に熱心だ。\n世界は間もなく[From.GetFirstName]が本当に主によって祝福されたかどうかを見ることだろう。

After receiving a vision of the Archangel Gabriel, who helped [From.GetHerHim] lead [From.GetHerHis] army through the treacherous path leading to Outremer, the children of [From.GetFirstName] have miraculously managed to reach Antioch before being spotted by the infidels.\nIn spite of the [From.GetBoyGirl]'s claim that the infidels would forsake the Devil upon their very arrival without the need for a fight, the heathens occupying Jerusalem have begun mobilizing their army, ready and eager to slaughter the innocent souls marching against them.\nThe world will soon see whether [From.GetFirstName] was truly blessed by the Lord, or if I was unwise to put my trust in this child.
[From.GetFirstName] will not fight this Crusade alone!
なんて貧しく、愚かな魂か…

あれほど多くの者を[From.GetFirstName]のもとへ駆り立てたのが何だったにせよ、それはもはや霧散したようだ。少年十字軍はもはや存在しない。かの軍団は壊滅して散り散りになり、主な支援者も死んだか行方をくらました。\nリーダーの[From.GetFirstName]は未だに自分が主の御言葉を伝えていると信じ込んでいるが、一日中街角に立って教会の堕落を嘆き、終末は近いと叫ぶ[From.GetHerHis]のことを、今や多くの人々はただの狂人と嘲っている。
遅かれ早かれ、いずれ起きることだったのだ。

異教徒軍の具体的な脅威に直面して、少年十字軍は何千もの泣き叫ぶ断片へと粉々になった。\n適切な指導力、装備、または訓練を受けた兵士もなく、[From.GetFirstName]は敵に立ち向かうことはできなかったのだ。[From.GetHerHis]に続く者たちを聖地に導くことができたにもかかわらず、エルサレム奪回のキリスト教徒の夢は満たされないだろう。\n支援者によって放棄された子供たちのほとんどは、敗北後に邪教徒によって捕獲された他の多くの子供たちと共に、奴隷として売却された。

[Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]に魅入られたに違いない、狂気の子は物乞いと若者の大軍を率いて、ついにエルサレムへたどり着いた。[From.GetHeSheCap]はかの聖地を神の名の下に取り返すのが[From.GetHerHis]の神聖な使命だと主張している。\nこの[From.GetBoyGirl]の言葉に騙されたおめでたい者どもは人数こそ驚異的だが、飢えた農民の群れが屈強な[Root.Religion.GetName]の兵士を野戦で打ち破れるという考えはじつに馬鹿げている。
奴らを子羊のように屠ってやろう。

異教徒軍の具体的な脅威に直面して、少年十字軍は何千もの泣き叫ぶ断片へと粉々になった。\n適切な指導力、装備、または訓練を受けた兵士もなく、[From.GetFirstName]は敵に立ち向かうことはできなかったのだ。[From.GetHerHis]に続く者たちを聖地に導くことができたにもかかわらず、エルサレム奪回のキリスト教徒の夢は満たされないだろう。\n異教徒は[From.GetHerHim]に従った愚かな大人全員を虐殺し、軍隊の中にいた子供たちを捕らえ、彼らすべてを奴隷として売り払った。
この結末は悲劇的だが、想像通りでもあった…
予想に違わず、自らの命を子供の手に託した愚か者どもは、敬虔な兵士たちによっていとも簡単に殺戮された。\nエルサレムへの十字軍は短命で一方的な結末だった。敵方には経験豊かな指揮官もおらず、武器も、鎧も、食糧もなかった...... 彼らが第一の目的地までたどり着けたのは、奇跡以外の何物でもなかった。\nわずかに生き残った子供は奴隷として売られ、故郷に帰り着いたものは一人もいなかった。
これ以外の結末など考えられない。
間違いない！神は[From.GetHerHim]と共にある！
I wish for [From.GetHerHis] reign to be long and prosperous!
I guess I should have trusted [From.GetHerHim]...
聖霊の導きにより、[This.GetTitledFirstName]はまだほんの子供だったにもかかわらず十字軍を成功させ、エルサレムを邪教徒の手から解放しました。
ガブリエルに選ばれし者
サイコロをグラ賽にすり替えようとした私の試みはばれてしまった。二言三言口論したすえに、[random_society_winner.GetBestName]は私からサイコロを奪い取ることに成功した。何度かそのサイコロを振って企みを明らかにすると、私をペテン師と呼ばわった。
いいだろう、金は持っていけ……
How about we consider it even?
I will make it up to you in some way, I promise!

Unfortunately, I was too indiscreet with my leg, and several warriors noticed my attempt to move the die after it was cast. After a bit of squabbling, I am forced to accept defeat and recognize that [random_society_winner.GetBestName] has won the bet.

Despite the other warriors not noticing me kneeing the table, fate played me for a fool and I ended up accidentally pushing the die away from [Root.GetWLDieBetName], much to my disappointment. [random_society_winner.GetBestName] smiles triumphantly, crossing [random_society_winner.GetHerHis] arms and demanding me to pay up.

A moment of silence falls upon our group as the die rolls from my hand and bounces a few times on the table, rolling to a halt to show the face of [Root.GetWLDieName]. As the realization catches [random_society_winner.GetHerHim], [random_society_winner.GetBestName] cheers triumphantly, immediately asking me for [random_society_winner.GetHerHis] money.

After the money from the first bets exchanges hands, I pick up the die and cast it again, trying to throw it exactly in the same way. The die rolls around the table and finally stops, showing the face of [Root.GetWLDieName]. As the realization catches [random_society_winner.GetHerHim], [random_society_winner.GetBestName] cheers triumphantly, immediately asking me for [random_society_winner.GetHerHis] money.

After the money from the first bets exchanges hands, I pick up the die and cast it again, trying to throw it exactly in the same way. The die rolls around the table and finally stops, showing the face of [Root.GetWLDieName]. As the realization catches him, one of the other warriors cheers triumphantly, immediately asking me for his money.
[From.GetBestName]と私は昨夜、他の戦士達とともに大広間でサイコロ遊びに興じていた。[From.GetFirstName]はよほどついていなかったらしく、夜が明ける頃には、私は[From.GetHerHis]の財布をほとんど空っぽにしていた。
もうゲームは飽きたか、[From.GetFirstName]？

[From.GetBestName] and I spent last evening playing dice games with some of the other warriors in the main hall. Fortune did not smile to [From.GetFirstName], and by the end of the night, [From.GetSheHe] begged me to call in the favor I owned [From.GetHerHim], just to avoid paying all of the debt [From.GetSheHe] had accumulated.
Perhaps you should not bet what you do not have?

[From.GetBestName] and I spent last evening playing dice games with some of the other warriors in the main hall. Fortune did not smile to [From.GetFirstName], and by the end of the night, [From.GetSheHe] begged me to ask [From.GetHerHim] anything else rather than paying all of the debt [From.GetSheHe] had accumulated.
I will think about this favor you owe me...
[Root.GetFirstName]が女をよろこばせたのは、母親の胎を占拠するのをやめて以来だ。
おまえの男らしさは小人の間では有名らしいな。
おまえの股の間についているモノほど臆病な戦士はいない。
最後におまえが男を見せた時のことは古老達から伝え聞くばかりだ。
おまえのように短い時間で女をよろこばせる奴は聞いたことがない。
おまえはもはや男ではないという奴がいるが、そもそも男だったことがあるのか？
男らしさを失っていると言うより、どこから見ても少女にしか見えないという方が相応しい。
おまえの逸物は切られたわけじゃない。使わないから縮んでなくなったのだ。
おまえの股の穴ほど不潔なところがあるか？
おまえがあんまり泣き叫ぶから、おまえと寝た男は耳栓くらいしか入れるものがないそうだな。
戦士の格好をしているのは、とても淑女としては通用しないからだろう？
この世のどこよりも見捨てられ、ウジが湧きそうな場所、それはおまえの子宮だ。
おまえほどそそられない奴は見たことがない。
Is it any surprise you would pick a game where you are the center of attention?
Try not to choke between turns, [From.GetFirstName], we have a long game ahead.
I am surprised you haven't started to whine about losing yet.
楽しんでいるか、[From.GetFirstName]？もう飽きたんじゃないだろうな？
だれか[From.GetFirstName]に、いくら喋っても金はもらえないと教えてやれ。
Are you sure Flyting is good for your temper, [From.GetFirstName]?
I have never met a [From.GetManWoman] more easily dumbfounded by a pretty face.
ここに来る前に豚小屋を這いずってでも来たのか？
おまえがそんなに醜いのは喧嘩に負けてボコボコにされたからか、それとも元からか？
私は屈服することになるかもしれないな。お前の顔は耐えられないほど醜い。
[From.GetFirstName]はひどい嫌われ者で、子供達は[From.GetHerHis]を見ると逃げ出してしまう。
[From.GetFirstName]の異様な顔を見れば、狼もおびえ石も割れるそうだ。
呪われてでもいるような不快な容貌だ、おまえの母親はどんな神を怒らせたのだ？
[From.GetFirstName]が女であることを思い出さない日はないと、皆言っているぞ。
戦士らしく戦わず、言葉遊びにかまけていると皆言っているぞ。
おまえのような軟弱者がどうして我らの一員になれると思ったのか、理解できないな。
Was there ever a weaker fighter recruited to [From.Society.GetName]?
骨折しないでこのテーブルに着けるとは感心したな……
気絶しないように手を握ってやろうか、お嬢ちゃん？
できるだけ穏やかに話すよう気をつけてやろう、さもないとおまえが死んでしまいそうだ。
Delicate as a flower, [From.GetFirstName] yet clings to dreams of war.
[From.GetFirstName]の根暗な性格で問題なかったのか？
Are you truly as dumb as you look, I wonder?
I will be using big words now, [From.GetFirstName], try to keep up.
機転が必要なゲームだということは理解しているんだろうな？
I am looking forward to your grunts of rebuttal, for sure.
Is it really such a surprise you jumped at the chance to yap some more?
さっさと諦めて部屋の隅でひっそりしていた方がよいのでは？
One can hardly find anything bad or good to say about [From.GetFirstName].
知りうる限りで最も怠惰な[From.GetManWoman]だ、ということさえお前には過ぎた栄誉だ。
板きれと同じくらいには面白い奴だ。
[From.Culture.GetName]人にはちっとも効きませんよ……
なんの才能も持たないからそんなに平凡に生きているのか？
果せない夢の道で精々躓かないよう気を付けるんだな。
一族の恥と言われるのはどんな気分なんだ？
